titleStmt.title: Declaration to the katholikos Consulate of Flavius Philippos and Flavius Salias, Choiak 13 (348 Dec. 9)
titleStmt.author: Ammon, Scholasticus, of Panopolis

msContents.summary: Declaration from Panopolis (modern name: Akhmim), Egypt. Written by Ammon, the well-known scholastikos, or lawyer, and son of Petearbeschinis, to Flavius Sisinnius, katholikos, a high official in Alexandria. Ammon has arrived in Alexandria from Panopolis after having been summoned by the katholikos to appear within twenty days after Hathyr 27 (November 23, A.D. 348) in Alexandria in person in the matter of the ownership of three slaves. The three slaves were formerly owned by Ammon's deceased brother Harpokration and had been seized as ownerless by Eugeneios, an imperial secretary
